summary: This document is a detailed AT&T wireless billing statement for accounts associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein & Co., covering the period from May 13, 2003, to June 12, 2003. It itemizes monthly service charges, call logs, messaging, roaming charges, and taxes for multiple phone lines, revealing extensive domestic and international calling patterns, including calls to locations like the United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, France, and various U.S. cities.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The primary account holder for multiple AT&T wireless lines billed to 'JEFFREY E EPSTEIN & CO' at 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY.

events.title: Wireless Billing Cycle
events.description: Monthly billing period for AT&T wireless services used by Jeffrey E Epstein & Co., detailing thousands of calls, messages, and roaming charges.

events.title: Payment Received
events.description: A payment of $1,420.53 was received and credited to the account.

keyFacts: The billing statement covers multiple wireless lines under 'JEFFREY E EPSTEIN & CO', showing extensive and frequent calling activity both domestically and internationally.

Detailed call logs show calls placed to and from numerous locations, including Washington D.C./Maryland area (suggesting political connections), Florida, and international calls to Europe and the Caribbean.
Roaming charges indicate international travel or phone use in Italy, France, Spain, Great Britain, and the U.S. Virgin Islands during the billing period.
The account incurred significant roaming charges totaling $649.01 for one line, including calls from locations like St. Thomas, VI, and various European countries.
The document is a routine financial record but provides a detailed snapshot of communication patterns and geographic movements associated with Epstein's accounts in mid-2003.
